properties.Title: Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms are expected to continue late this evening into the overnight hours. These thunderstorms may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts of 50 knots or more along with very large hail. There is also a risk of a tornado. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-06-09T09:14:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-09T02:50:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3002649303.2020
Area: Lake of the Woods
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and damaging hail. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-06-09T08:59:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-09T02:43:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0423154011.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: First heat event of the year expected Tuesday. Daytime high temperatures are expected to reach 30 degrees Celsius tomorrow with humidex values near 36. Cooler air will move in on Wednesday as Tropical Depression Cristobal approaches. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-06-09T18:52:29-00:00

properties.Title: Tornado Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms which may produce tornadoes. Hazards: - A few tornadoes. - Ping pong ball to tennis ball size hail. - Damaging wind gusts of 100 to 130 km/h. Locations: Portions of Northwestern Ontario near and south of Highway 17 including Kenora, Dryden and Fort Frances. Timing: Early this morning. Remember, a Tornado Watch means tornadoes and severe thunderstorms are possible in and close to the watch area. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-06-09T10:37:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-09T05:10:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4162209385.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Hazards: - Ping pong ball size hail - Damaging wind gusts of 100 km/h - Rainfall amounts near 50 mm over a few areas Locations: Portions of Northwestern Ontario. Timing: Continuing early this morning. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:59 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking an area of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. This area of thunderstorms is located southeast of Ignace, moving east at 50 km/h. Locations impacted include: English River and the Gulliver Lake area. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-06-09T07:58:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-06-09T05:00:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2170147634.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:37 a.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking an area of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. These thunderstorms is located north of Raith, moving east at 60 km/h. Hazards: 90 km/h wind gusts and nickel sized hail. Locations impacted include: Lac des Iles, Eaglehead Lake and Cheeseman Lake. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
